page.title: 17Owning a horse
page.content: If you want to own a horse the best thing is to live in the country.At least 27 horses are owned by people in the village.I own an Anglo-Arab called Hassann.To own a horse you need a paddock of course,but in the winter you need a stable with plenty of hay and straw for the bedding and feed.I also feed Hassann on a coarse mix of flaked maize,oats,pony nuts and vitamins.Sometimes he has a hot bran mash.One of the less delightful jobs of owning a horse is mucking out!It is AWFUL! And your pony needs mucking out every day before school.I keep mine in over night and turn him out in the morning with a New Zealand Rug in the winter.For the horse you need a saddle and bridle and you must have the proper kit to ride in.If you keep your horse fit and healthy you can take it to shows.
